greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers n such that n divides 4^n + 3.
comment: Number of solutions < 10^9 to k^n == k-1 (mod n): 1 (if k = 1), 188 (if k = 2, see A006521), 5 (if k = 3, see A015973), 5 (if k = 4, see this sequence), 5 (if k = 5), 10 (if k = 6), 10 (if k = 7), 7 (if k = 8), 5 (if k = 9), 8 (if k = 10), 11 (if k = 11), 8 (if k - 12), 9 (if k = 13), 4 (if k = 14), 3 (if k = 15), 6 (if k = 16), 7 (if k = 17), 7 (if k = 18), ...
program: (MAGMA) [1] cat [n: n in [1..10^8] | Modexp(4,n,n) + 3 eq n];
xref: Cf. Solutions to k^n == 1-k (mod n): A006521 (k = 2), A015973 (k = 3), this sequence (k = 4), ...
results.author: _Juri-Stepan Gerasimov_, Sep 27 2019
